snippet: From 2010 to 2013, police officers came to her home nine times in response to domestic disputes, including arguments, harassment and assault, police officials said.
abstract: New York City detectives are investigating death of 2-year-old Kevasia Edwards, who was found at her family’s home in Queens with broken ribs and bruising around her mouth; police officials say Kevasia had been surrounded by violence and abuse for much of her short life; from 2010 to 2013, police officers came to her home nine times in response to domestic disputes.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and JULIE TURKEWITZ

lead_paragraph: From 2010 to 2013, police officers came to her home nine times in response to domestic disputes, including arguments, harassment and assault, police officials said.

headline.main: 2-Year-Old Girl Dies in Home With a History of Violence
headline.print_headline: 2-Year-Old Girl Dies in Home With a History of Violence
